Dear Mr. Hawkins:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.

ALLEGATION:
Youth went AWOL from facility. Youth reported they were going to take a shower
and staff failed to complete required 15-minute check.
INVESTIGATION:
Documentation Reviewed:
 Student Supervision Procedure 2021. The expectation for staff to supervisor
youth is outlined in this procedure and includes but is not limited to the
following expectations:
2

o YDS staff will complete the Daily Observation Record for each student
they are responsible for. The Daily Observation record will be handed
off to the YDS when the supervision responsibility changes. Staff will
keep the Daily Observation Record on their person at all times and
document at varying 15 minute intervals, utilizing the key outlined on
the Daily Observation Record. If a student is on At-Risk or Suicide
Status, the Status Checklist forms will be used in placed of the Daily
observation record. Frequency of checks may be increased during At-
Risk or Suicide Status. YDS staff must follow all directions located on
the status paperwork directed by the clinical team.
o YDS are responsible for the direct supervision of students living in the
house in which they are working. To ensure appropriate supervision,
YDS and other agency staff responsible for students must:
 a. Know which students are being supervised by which staff at
all times
 b. Know where each student is at all times
 c. Be physically present in close proximity to the student
 d. Maintain visual contact and monitoring of the student
 e. Monitor interactions between students
 f. Accompany and supervise students whenever they move
around campus
 g. Clearly communicate when the supervision of student/s
transfers to another staff person (example: “you are now
responsible for student A because I am leaving the basketball
court to go make dinner”) and ensure the student’s Daily
Observation Record is transferred to the staff assuming
supervision responsibilities.
 h. Ensure hallways are being monitored at all times when
students are in their rooms, den, bathrooms, laundry room,
common hallway space or med cart area. If a staff member
must leave their post as direct supervisor of the hallway, they
will notify another staff to take over this supervision. Staff will
position themselves in common areas where direct line of site of
hallways can easily be achieved while preventing being
obtrusive of student’s privacy (i.e. Staff position their seat at the
table to be able to monitor both hallways).
 Daily Observation Record for Youth A dated 7/18/2021. Staff 1 completed the
form from 11:30am until 1:30pm indicating checks were completed at 11:30,
11:45, 12:00, 12:15, 12:30, 12:45, 1:00, and 1:15. Staff 1 documented Youth
A AWOLed at the 1:30 check.
 Runaway Fact Sheet for Youth A dated 7/18/2021. Youth A’s time of AWOL
was 1:29pm. The form is completed with Youth A’s identifying information and
all contacts that were made after his AWOL.
 Youth A’ incident report dated 7/18/2021 regarding his AWOL. The incident
report narrative describes the events leading up to Youth A’s AWOL and how
it was discovered he was missing.
3

 Video Review from 1pm-1:30pm. The video footage showed Youth A down
his hallway sneaking his shoes and bag outside and then leaving the facility
and leaving the door cracked open slightly. The video footage showed Staff 1
sitting in the milieu area without visual supervision of Youth A’s hallway. The
video footage showed that the 1:15 check Staff 1 documented as being done
was not actually completed as no one checked Youth A at that time.
 Staff 1’s employee file. Staff 1 had appropriate training through the facility and
was up to date on his training hours. Staff 1 did have one prior disciplinary
report dated 1/30/2021 for Insubordination, failure to follow direction from
previous warnings, and failing to obey agency/program policy and/or
procedures. Staff 1 was also on a corrective action plan for issues including
attendance, changing his work schedule without supervisor approval,
reaching out to administration prior to communicating with his direct
supervisor, and struggling with confidence on shift. Staff 1 was on weekly
supervision for improvement in his performance.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 26, 2021. Staff 1 said he
has worked at St. John’s Home Residential for about one and a half years. Staff 1 said
he has worked in two different units however confirmed that the supervision polices are
the same for both units. Staff 1 confirmed he is aware of and has been trained on the
expectations of supervision of youth in the program. Staff 1 said he was supervising
Youth A on July 18, 2021. Staff 1 said Youth A had asked to make a phone call about
1pm. Staff 1 said Youth A ended up making several calls during this time as no one was
answering his calls. Staff 1 said Youth A was dialing the number’s himself as he has his
contact list memorized however Staff 1 said he was not watching the numbers or
comparing them to the contact list so could not be sure Youth A was calling approved
people off his phone list. Staff 1 said Youth A was not able to get anyone to answer his
calls and so asked if he could take a shower. Staff 1 said Youth A’s bathroom door was
already open as he had been prepping to take a shower and so Staff 1 walked to the
milieu to work on paperwork as Youth A went down the hallway towards his bathroom.
Staff 1 said he was sitting in the milieu doing paperwork and Supervisor A and
Supervisor B came into the house and were talking with him. Staff 1 said Supervisor A
and Supervisor B got up from the milieu area and started to walk towards the den which
is in the same hallway as Youth A’s bedroom and bathroom. Staff 1 said Supervisor A
noticed the exit door at the end of the hallway was slightly ajar and so went to close it
and do a check on Youth A. Staff 1 said he went down the hallway once Supervisor A
said the door had been opened. Staff 1 said he knocked on the bathroom door to check
on Youth A and there was no response, so he opened the door and Youth A was not in
the bathroom. Staff 1 said he, Supervisor A and Supervisor B then proceeded to look for
Youth A for about an hour but were not able to find Youth A. They completed all the
AWOL paperwork and calls. Staff 1 said he had been doing checks on Youth A however
had missed a 15-minute check and instead had completed the check at the 26 minute
mark. Staff 1 said he had documented the missed check and said he had been working
on paperwork, talking to supervisors, and had a personal issue that was weighing on his
mind that day and simply forgot the check. Staff 1 denied falsifying the documentation
and said he did write the correct times of the checks.
4

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 said he was aware of the policy and procedures of St.
John’s Home and his employee file confirmed he had been
trained on agency policies and procedures. Staff 1 did not follow
the agency policy of completing 15-minute checks on Youth A or
ensuring supervision of Youth A’s hallway as required.
In addition, Supervisor A and Supervisor B were both seen on
video entering the unit and sitting and talking with Staff 1 in the
milieu area not addressing that Staff 1 was not supervising the
hallway as required or going to supervise the hallway
themselves.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

APPLICABLE RULE
MCL 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of conditions,
books, records, and reports; access by department, bureau
of fire services, or local authorities; records; report; forms;
confidentiality; disclosure of information; availability of
confidential records; child information cards to be provided
to department; failure of licensee to cooperate with
investigation, inspection, or examination.
Sec. 10. (1) The department may investigate, inspect, and
examine conditions of a childcare organization and may
investigate and examine the books and records of the licensee.
The licensee shall cooperate with the department’s
5

investigation, inspection, and examination by doing all of the
following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the
department, and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and
household members, to provide accurate and truthful
information to the department.
ANALYSIS: Staff 1 completed the Daily Observation Record indicating a
check at 1:15 however reported that he did the check at 1:26
and video footage showed there was no check completed at
1:15. Staff 1 falsified the Daily Observation Record.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.
